p: The coronavirus polyprotein encodes two proteases, which share in its processing and release of the translated non-structural proteins (NSPs), the main protease is called 3-C-like protease (M-pro) and a papain-like protease (Plpro) [ 8]. Both Plpro and Mpro were vital targets for drug discovery studies against the recent coronavirus epidemics including SARS and MERS CoV [ [9], [10], [11], [12]].
